Class GroceryStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GroceryStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GroceryStore
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    The GroceryStore class is the class that has the grocery store and has different foods for the user to buy and feed their critter.
    Version:
    4 06.05.15 Time Spent by Jasmine Ou: 12 hours. Time Spent by Laura Wong: none.

    name: GroceryStore.java

    Instance variables:

    foodItem [][] 2D Food array that stores all the different foods in the grocery store with 5 rows and 12 columns.

    blank Food item that indicates no food selected in the grocery store.

    selectedItem Food variable that indicates the selected food chosen and is initialized to the blank food variable.

    itemName Creates an instance of the JLabel class with the String title "Item Name" to display the selected item's name.

    itemPrice Creates an instance of the JLabel class with the String title "$0" to display the selected item's price.

    ptsLabel Creates an instance of the JLabel class

    totalPrice Creates an instance of the JLabel class with the String title "$0" to display the selected item's price.

    buyIt Creates an instance of the JButton class with the String title "BUY".

    exit Creates an instance of the JButton class with the String title "EXIT".

    spinnerModel A Spinner Model that creates an instance of the SpinneNumberModel class with a minimum of 1, incrementation of 1 and maximum of 12.

    spinner Creates an instance of the JSpinner class using the spinnerModel to let the user select the quantity of an item.

    confirmPurchaseDialog Integer that stores the value of the user's choice in the JOptionPane shown.

    quantity Integer that stores the quantity of the food item initialized to 1.

    Author:
    Jasmine Ou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GroceryStore

        public GroceryStore()
        The GroceryStore constructor adds a MouseListener to the JPanel, sets the Layout to null, sets the location of all the two JButtons, two JLabels and JSpinner. An ActionListener is added to each button which can either buy an item or exit the store. All JComponents are added to the JPanel. The stockStore method is called.

    • Method Detail

      • setButtonsActionListener

        public void setButtonsActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        The setButtonsActionListener method adds an ActionListener to each button and sets their action commands.
        Parameters:
        al - is the ActionListener passed in to be added to the buttons.

      • stockStore

        public void stockStore()
        Stocks the Grocery store with food by adding Food objects to the foodItems array from reading in a text file. The try block is for reading the foods.txt file and to catch the IOException. The for loop starts from 0 and increments by 1 while x is smaller than 5. The nested for loop starts from 0 and increments by 1 while y is smaller than 12.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        in Creates an instance of the BufferedReader class for file reading.

        name String that stores the Food's name.

        price String that stores the Food's price.

        foodGroup Integer that stores the Food's foodGroup.

        icon String that stores the Food icon's file name.

        nutrientValue A double that stores the Food's nutrientValue.

        x An int loop variable that starts from 0 and increments by 1 while x is smaller than 5 for as the row number in the 2D array foodItems.

        y An int loop variable that starts from 0 and increments by 1 while y is smaller than 12 for as the column number in the 2D array foodItems.

        Exception IOException e when an error occurs with file io where the file cannot be read.

      • buy

        public void buy()
        The buy method is called when the user wants to buy something. If there is enough fridge space and enough points, the food item selected is added to the fridge and points are deducted. Else, the errorMessage method is called.

      • confirmPurchase

        public void confirmPurchase()
        The confirmPurchase method creates and displays a JOptionPane to ask the user to confirm their purchase.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        options[] Object of the options of the confirmPurchaseDialog.

        confirmPurchaseDialog The JOptionPane OptionDialog to ask the user to confirm their purchase.

      • errorMessage

        public void errorMessage()
        The errorMessage method creates and displays a JOptionPane to inform the user of an error. If the quantity of food to be bought is larger than the available fridge space, message adds a string the inform the user that there is not enough room in the fridge. If the total price is more than their points, then message adds a string the inform the user thatthey do not have enough points.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        message String that stores the error message.

      • correctCol

        public static boolean correctCol(int clickX,
                                 int iconX)
        The correctCol method is used to determine whether the user clicked in the column specified in the parameters or not. The if statement checks if the user clicked within the 60 by 60 square of a food icon starting from the indicated left most pixel.
        Parameters:
        clickX - int of the x coordinate of the user's mouse click.
        iconX - int of an icon's left most x coordinate.
        Returns:
        false if it is the wrong row, else, true.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        The mouseClicked method coordinates the proper response to the user's mouse clicks. The first for loop starts from 0, increments by 90 each time while row is less than or equal to 360 in order to go through the rows. The if statement checks if the user's mouse click is in the row of the loop variable and it breaks the loop. If true, the nested for loop starts from 0, increments by 63 each time while row is less than or equal to the foodItem array row's length plus one times 63. Or else, the Food blank is assigned to the selectedItem variable. The next if statement checks if the user's mouse click is in the column of the loop variable. If true, the one spot of the Food 2D array is assigned to the selectedItem variable and it breaks the loop.

        Local Variables:

        row int loop variable that starts from 0, increments by 90 each time while row is less than or equal to 360.

        col int loop variable that starts from 0, increments by 63 each time while row is less than or equal to the foodItem array row's length plus one times 63.

        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent that stores the user's mouse actions.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrided paintComponent method of the Graphics class to draw background and food icons on to the JPanel. The pictures include the store's background and the food icons.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        bg An Image the creates an instance of the ImageIcon class that stores the store's background image.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - An instance of the Graphics class.
